channel.title: Tensor on Datumorphism
channel.description: Recent content in Tensor on Datumorphism

item.title: Tensor Factorization
item.description: Tensors We will be talking about tensors but we will skip the introduction to tensor for now. In this article, we follow a commonly used convention for tensors in physics, the abstract index notation. We will denote tensors as $T^{ab\cdots}_ {\phantom{ab\cdots}cd\cdots}$, where the latin indices such as $^{a}$ are simply a placebo for the slot for this “tensor machine”. For a given basis (coordinate system), we can write down the components of this tensor $T^{\alpha\beta\cdots} _ {\phantom{\alpha\beta\cdots}\gamma\delta\cdots}$.

item.title: Khatri-Rao Product
item.description: Choose X from N is $$ C_N^X = \frac{N!}{ X! (N-X)! } $$
